Go into every conversation or meeting with the mindset of learning. No matter what the circumstances are, no matter what the setting is, even if you are the one leading a workshop or a talk, be in the mindset to learn.  As I continue to meet so many amazing people this year, I am blown away by the ideas, stories and drive coming out of others.  I go to events and I meet someone and I always seem to learn something new. I do workshops and I pay attention to how others respond and I listen to their feedback, input and questions, and I learn.  I recently did a guest talk for a group of Seniors in the Sawyer Business School at Suffolk University.  Thru their answers, questions and curiosity about how to approach their career, I learned from them.  I'll be better the next time I do a workshop because of what I learned from that audience of students last night.  CALL TO ACTION:  Be mindful of listening and learning in every single interaction and conversation you have.  It benefits you, and it benefits others.

March 13, 2015, Christopher reported directly to Paul

Paul was a great IT Director to work with for this one project.  He was charged with the complex process of consolidating several applications, each having different persistent store types.  Paul was masterful in remaining calm and cool, making the right pragmatic decisions, and was an effective communicator up and down the command chain.  His strong set of ethics radiated in way he went through his work day.  Treated everyone consistently the same with respect, and inviting to anyone speak up regarding ideas and/or concerns.  Highly recommend Paul as a leader and strategist!

summary: "What is a leader? As I use the term here, the job of a leader is to accomplish transformation of his organization. He possesses knowledge; he himself has been transformed. He has personality and persuasive power. How may he accomplish transformation? First he has theory. He understands why the transformation would bring gain to his organization and to all the people that his organization deals with, the customers, suppliers, environment. Second, he feels compelled to accomplish the transformation as an obligation to himself and to his organization. Third, he is a practical man. He has a plan, step by step.” - W. Edwards Deming, 1992Transformational Technology Leader in Enterprise Software Delivery- Business Strategy to Technology Planning - Business Product Value Stream Analysis & Migration- Technology Portfolio Management / PMO leadership for Waterfall, Agile Scrum, LeanXP teams- Technology transformation change coach- Scrum Master, Agile Coach and Scaled Agile Program Consultant Certified- Scaled Agile Framework Trainer- Leader in managing highly productive software delivery teams and continuous delivery - Over 15 years leading enterprise software delivery planning, team building, automation, delivery, improvement, and transformation to Agile- Lead architecture planning, data management, and disaster recovery planning- Manage application development teams for Java, .NET, BI, Big Data, and COTS systems- Partner with business leaders in Internet Marketing, Pharmaceutical & Medical Claims, Insurance, Accounting, Financial, Brokerage, Banking, Manufacturing, Supply Chain, Customer Service automation, Property & Casualty, and Software Product Management.
